greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A070080(n)^2 + A070081(n)^2 - A070082(n)^2.
comment: The integer triangle [A070080(n)<=A070081(n)<=A070082(n)] is acute iff a(n)>0, right iff a(n)=0 and obtuse iff a(0)<0.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Acute Triangle.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Right Triangle.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Obtuse Triangle.
mathematica: sides[per_] := Select[Reverse /@ IntegerPartitions[per, {3}, Range[Ceiling[ per/2]]], #[[1]] < per/2 && #[[2]] < per/2 && #[[3]] < per/2&];
triangles = DeleteCases[Table[sides[per], {per, 3, m}], {}] // Flatten[#, 1]& // SortBy[Total[#] m^3 + #[[1]] m^2 + #[[2]] m + #[[1]]&];
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 05 2002
